numbered_ace_sentences: 3. Some legacy applicants have richer parents.
4. A legacy applicant with richer parents has a higher chance of getting into college.
5. A non-legacy applicant has a lower chance of getting admitted to college.
6. There is a big gap between legacy applicants and non-legacy applicants who get into college.
7. I wonder why there is such a big gap between legacy applicants and non-legacy applicants who get into college.
10. There is a big gap between applicants with higher-income parents and applicants with lower-income parents.
11. I wonder why there is such a big gap between the richer side and the poorer side of the parent's income.
13. This situation relates to my community.
14. People in my community will apply to colleges soon.
15. We need to consider whether we are legacy applicants at some colleges.
16. We need to save up money to get into college.
17. The headline is: College is only for the rich and for legacy applicants.
